full_text: Form G-58 (7-15-46) U. ED STATES DEPARTMENT OF JUSTICE IMMIGRATION AND NATURALIZATION SERVICE A6 699 884 ST. PAUL. MINN. File No. Date January 23, 1951, (Address of requesting office) DIRECTOR, FEDERAL BUREAU OF INVESTIGATION, DEPARTMENT OF JUSTICE, Washington 25, D. C. Attention: Identification Division Please furnish a copy of any criminal record shown in the fingerprint records of your Bureau con- cerning the following person: Name LIU MAOLING (Surname) (Given name) (Middle and other names) Aliases none Alien Registration No. FBI No. or Visa Application No. 16-1947 Date of birth A pril 13, 1904 Birthplace Shouluunghsien, Shantung, China. (Month) (Day) (Year) (Town) (Country) Marital status married Name of spouse Thelma Bosland Liu Race Chinese Color yellow Sex male Occupation student Complexion fair Eyes brown Hair black Height 5'8" 157 Visible marks none Places of residence last 5 years (include street and number) : Methodist Mission, Peking, China, 1945-46 THIN FEB Weight 12.1951 SERVICE IMM. & NAT. PAUL Dormitary of No. Chim Power Co., Peking, China, 1946 to Nov. 1946 ST. 27 Oak St., Minneapolis; P 71 Univ.Village Minneapolis, 5052 Cedar ave. Mpls, Places of employment 5 years: last 630 Lincoln St. NE., inneapolis Minn. North China Power Co., Peking, Chim. Univ. of Minn., Minneapolis, Minn. NO CRIMINAL RECORD The subject is | An applicant for naturalization. An applicant for a certificate of lawful entry. JAN 31 1951 Applicant for extension of stay IDENTIFICATION DIVISION FBI Fingerprints are (not) attached. $16.57, Please mail the attached copy of this request with your reply to the address shown below.
